etymologies: mid 17th century; earliest use found in Thomas Blount (1618–1679), antiquary and lexicographer

definitions: Abnormal craving for certain kinds of food. Formerly also: †queasiness, nausea (obsolete). Now chiefly historical.
Abnormal softening or loss of density of a tissue or organ, now especially of the brain, spinal cord, or tracheobronchial cartilage.

notes.text: More common as a suffix: see -malacia.
